column5: Hit a local, overfished little pit north of me today, bass and pike on the agenda. Nothing going on, real tough all afternoon. A 12 inch largemouth and a lost topwater pike were all i had. We pull up to a point on the way back, i cast at it about 6 times and say "i have no idea why the bass wouldnt be stacked behind that"... Make cast # 7, 8, 9, 10, 11 and catch a bass on every single one, ending with the main event, a 4 pounder. Couldn't get a freakin bite all day, fished that point already 4 other times, then when i say that, the fish woke up. Eerie! But im not complaining about that night one bit.
should have started chatting with them earlier
Bass do that dood. Good on ya for re-visiting promising structure! Sometimes timing is the only thing needed
I talk to them all the time.Usually folowing a "COME ON YOU......." Then i go back to sniffing for fish farts.
Bull, your hauling in fish left, right front and center this year! Wheres your attitude? Come on Dood, get with the program!
Sticking with my plans this year.Less "outings" but better planning and new water almost every week.So far so good.
